intro: Elytranthe lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf elytranthe, is a perennial herb native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface, and it produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and unique foliage, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
